alert.note: Alert for Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 6:01PM EDT until August 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Slatington, Jordan Valley, Schnecksville, Neffs, New Tripoli, Emerald, Coffeetown, Wanamakers, Coplay, and North Catasauqua. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 61 and 71. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
